record_data.record_plain_text:
BLACK HILLS COLORADO WIND, LLC
FERC ELECTRIC TARIFF, VOLUME NO. 1 MARKET-BASED RATE POWER SALES TARIFF
1. Applicability: This Tariff is applicable to all wholesale sales of electric energy, capacity and/or ancillary services by Black Hills Colorado Wind, LLC ("Black Hills Colorado Wind") at market-based rates. 2. Availability: Black Hills Colorado Wind makes electric energy and/or capacity available under this Tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below, with whom Black Hills Colorado Wind has contracted. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Black Hills Colorado Wind. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Black Hills Colorado Wind. 5. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Black Hills Colorado Wind shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Black Hills Colorado Wind's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Black Hills Colorado Wind to engage in affiliate sales under this Tariff or otherwise restricts or limits Black Hills Colorado Wind's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Black Hills Colorado Wind's market-based rate authority will constitute a violation of this Tariff. 6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: Black Hills Colorado Wind has received (a) Waiver of the accounting, reporting, and other requirements of 18 C.F.R. Parts 41 (accounts, records, and memorandum), 101 (uniform system of accounts) and 141 (statements and reports) with exception of Sections 141.14 and 141.15; (b) waiver of the reporting requirements of Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission's regulations, except Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16; and (c) blanket authorization under 18 C.F.R. part 34 of all future issuances of securities and assumptions of liability. See AltaGas Renewable Energy Colorado LLC, 140 FERC 61,089 (2012). The Commission authorized Black Hills Colorado Wind to engage in affiliate power sales with Black Hills Colorado Electric, Inc. under the terms of the Renewable Energy Purchase Agreement entered into between the parties on December 22, 2011, as amended on September 20, 2018, with Black Hills Colorado Wind acting as seller and Black Hills Colorado Electric, Inc. acting as purchaser. See AltaGas Renewable Energy Colorado LLC, 165 FERC 61,196 (2018). 7. Seller Category: Black Hills Colorado Wind is a Category 2 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a)(3), for the Northwest region as defined in FERC Order Nos. 697 and 697-A. Black Hills Colorado Wind is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a), in all other geographic regions defined in FERC Order Nos. 697 and 697-A. 8. Ancillary Services: PJM: Black Hills Colorado Wind offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
New York: Black Hills Colorado Wind offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc.
New England: Black Hills Colorado Wind offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc.
California: Black Hills Colorado Wind offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO.
MISO: Black Hills Colorado Wind offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. ("MISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO.
9. Third Party Services: Black Hills Colorado Wind also offers the following third-party ancillary services: Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to a Regional Transmission Organization or an Independent System Operator, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with Black Hills Colorado Wind, or sales where the underlying transmission services is on the system of the public utility affiliated with Black Hills Colorado Wind; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers. 10. Revisions to Tariff: Black Hills Colorado Wind may file revisions to this Tariff with the Commission. Nothing contained in this Tariff shall be construed as affecting or limiting in any way the right of Black Hills Colorado Wind to unilaterally file with the Commission for a change in any aspect of this Tariff under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act pursuant to the Commission's Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. 11. Effective Date: This Tariff is effective on such date as specified by the Commission.
record_data.filing_title: Revised Tariff, Notice of Category 2 Seller NW and Status Change, ER12-1875
